poem:
Title: "In Politics and Reality"

With shouts of Order, he found appeal,
In Commons' hay, Bercow spun the wheel.
Once the Chamber's rabid hound,
Now a new chaos to be found.
A bully's posture masked with grin,
With politics a traitor's kin.
His cry - once echoed in debate,
Resounds in a reality quite second-rate.
A jester in a new-aged court,
His rule, once firm, now a sport.
